page.title: 19 FROM EYE TO WOOFFERTON
page.content: Extract from{1860}handbook of the {Shrewsbury to Hereford Railway. 'On leaving Eye Station is a hill, called{King's Hill,}and thence a series of rising ground close to the line for a distance of two miles impedes the view. About two miles from the station and half a mile from the line westward, the Spire of{Orleton Church stands out among the trees.Etymologists differ concerning the origin of this name. Some derive it from{Earl's Town,}others from the {Orle (Alder) Trees}which are abundant in this Parish.The narrow piece of water lying between two rows of trees,and over which the line crosses, is part of the{Canal,}made at the latter end of the last century, between{Leominster and Kington,}and {Leominster and Stourport.'} More about the canal on the next page of text.
